name: Courtyard Page at Lake Powell

reviews.text: I didnt like this hotel because staff is not kindly, profesional and helpful especialy breakfast manager. Breakfast was disgusting. Housekeeping is not well done, sheet seem to be suspect and crumple when we arrived in room. This was the worst hotel I done during a 5 weeks trip in USA. We stayed 3 nights.
reviews.title: Staff not kindly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise swimming pool is nice and rooms pleasant.
reviews.title: Highly recommended.

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. The front desk upgraded us to a room upon finding out that it was our Anniversary, even though we checked in very late. The room was great with all the amenities and a god view. Good breakfast too. Made to order Omelettes. Very busy with European tourists.
reviews.title: Perfectly Fine Oasis in the AZ Desert

reviews.text: Finding this hotel from the road signs may be a little tricky, but once you do, you'll enjoy the locale and amenities.
reviews.title: Not worth cat 6 rating

reviews.text: The pros: Super friendly and very helpful front desk staff (a major plus in my book). Modern, spacious clean room with really quite nice artwork on the walls (photos of local canyon attractions). Cool local adobe-style architecture of the buildings. Significantly sized pool. Fairly large buffet breakfast, with half price for children. Two really nice external reading areas with large lounges, and then a couple of nice internal reading areas (for when it's too hot outside). Cute as all heck baby bunny hanging out by the pool (OK, my kids made me add that). Computers easily accessible right off the lobby (on the way to the pool). This was definitely a great value for the price.
reviews.title: Comfortable in good location and strong amenities, service problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location, about a 5-10 minute drive from Lake Powell Marina.
reviews.title: Lovely large room, nice pool area

reviews.text: Staff at the front desk seem like they can't really be bothered to help (although they did help us). The pool area was lovely and it was nice to come back and relax after a day out. Our room was absolutely huge with 2 queen beds and it was lovely and clean. We ate breakfast at the hotel, it was very average given the choice and quality. The staff serving us at breakfast were pleasant and friendly. We did not eat our evening meal at the hotel as there was plenty of choice in the town.
reviews.title: Worst service of our whole trip!
Pricy and so-so service
reviews.text: Booked our room 10 months ago and requested a roll out bed. Checked in early yesterday and was told no roll outs avalible, they were allocated on a first come first served basis, despite seeing 2 being removed from rooms being cleaned. Went to front desks to see what other options there were but staff were very unhelpful. Found another hotel and went to the front desk to check out. Staff then told us another guest, not yet checked in, had been allocated a roll out and they could ask them when they arrived if they needed it. How is that first come first served if we got here first? You obviously have to be in the know with the staff to get allocated any requests in this hotel! Very poor service from uninterested staff in a rather tired over priced hotel!
Gone to the Best Western with friendly staff, cheaper and it includes breakfast.
reviews.title: Almost like a resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even with AAA discount (which did save about $40), it is still a bit pricy as breakfast is not included. Asked for roll bed, extra pillow/blanket, and towel, none were there in the room. It was suggested to use the sofa bed - didn't realize that there was no sheets until time to bed...
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way around Utah and Arizona. (We are from Australia.) We were happy with it and did not have any major issues. I think you could do a lot worse. It is a chain hotel so it is never going to be at the top of your list of "must see accommodation venues" but it was adequate, clean and we didn't find the staff unpleasant. It is also set back well away from the road so wasn't too noisy. Breakfast included but pretty basic, (which suited us fine).
reviews.title: What we expected.

reviews.text: We stopped here for two nights during our recent visit to Page. The Hotel is situated in a nice spot on the edge of the town, there are views back over towards the Glen Canyon bridge, it is walkable into Page (if you wanted to).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: It is well placed to visit a number of local attractions which include, Horseshoe Bend, Glen Canyon & Dam, Lake Powell, Antelope Canyon, Colorado River Discovery (rafting) and others.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but some staff issues

reviews.text: The room was a nice size with two queen sized beds, it was modern and clean, there were coffee making facilities. The bathroom was fine, nothing to fault at all. Overall cost was not too bad either.
reviews.title: Very welcoming stop on long road trip!

reviews.text: The staff were helpful enough and pleasant. If there was one negative it was that the free Wi-Fi was patchy and slow. There were free internet kiosks but these were not that fast either.
reviews.title: Average chain hotel, good for Page though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in other Page hotels and suggest you just spend the extra $50 to stay here. Other hotels in the area are lacking. The staff here is friendly, the rooms are clean and well maintained as are the grounds. Using this as the start or end of an adventure in AZ or UT is perfect. Other hotels have left a bad taste and hurt the experience of a trip. This hotel won't disappoint.
reviews.title: Expensive, but BEST option in Page.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of the great view and the location they can charge luxury rates like in Hollywood and New York. But this hotel is just a "normal" one, just have a look in the fitness "center" first. Don't expect too much for the price. Rooms are nice and clean, though, but 340 for one night is way too much. We were booked in for 4 nights, but cancelled the other 3 which was no problem at all. The staff didn't care anyway, it seemed. No question why we wanted to leave earlier. One day might be enough anyway to see all the attractions in the area (lake powell, glen canyon dam, horseshoe bend). Joerg and Alina (Soest/Germany)
reviews.title: Too expensive

reviews.text: Page is an interesting little town which exists solely due to Glen Canyon damn. There is a lot to see and do here and this hotel is probably the nicest in town. It does seem a bit overpriced however, considering the accomodations. The rooms are nice enough, clean and large, but the air conditioning sounds like a jet engine. The internet, which is included, works most of the time, but can be quite slow. Breakfast was not included in our room rate. The elevator appears a bit run down and is small for a hotel this size.
reviews.title: The Good Does Not Justify the Price
Maybe the best hotel in town, however a lower standard
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, but there are hotels close by that had better rates.

The lobby is quite small and not really a nice place to sit and hang out. The pool area is great if you have kids. Not a good place for a quiet swim unless you get there first thing in the morning or late at night.
reviews.title: Oasis

aka: Courtyard Page At Lake Powell Hotel
description: Overlooking Arizona's breathtaking Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and the pristine waters of Lake Powell, the Courtyard Page, AZ at Lake Powell hotel is the perfect choice for business travel or a family vacation to the area. Relax in our 153 deluxe Southwestern-style guest rooms near Lake Powell, featuring free HBO, complimentary wireless high-speed internet access, luxurious Marriott bedding and an ergonomic work space. The meeting and convention space will comfortably accommodate anywhere from 4 to 400 people. Our Southwestern-themed hotel, surrounded by Lake Powell National Golf Course, is located within minutes of Glen Canyon Dam, Antelope Canyon, Wahweap and Antelope Point marinas. Take a day trip from our Glen Canyon hotel to experience the awe-inspiring sights of the Zion, Bryce Canyon, the Grand Canyon and the incredible mesas of Monument Valley. Whether traveling for business or leisure, the Courtyard Page, AZ Lake Powell has anticipated your every need.
